senses.sense_definition: A person who belongs to the goth subculture, typically dressing in black and listening to gothic rock.

examples.text: We saw a solitary <w>goth</w> waiting by the train station.
As a teenager, she was a <w>goth</w> who dyed her hair black.

senses.sense_definition: A subculture characterized by dark fashion, mournful music, and macabre aesthetics.

examples.text: Philip has been into <w>goth</w> for many years.
The documentary explored the origins of <w>goth</w> in the 1980s.

senses.sense_definition: A style of rock music influenced by glam rock and punk, known for its dark atmosphere; gothic rock.

examples.text: The band plays a mix of industrial and <w>goth</w>.
Many people do not realize that <w>goth</w> evolved from punk.

senses.sense_definition: A member of the East Germanic people known for invading the Roman Empire and founding successor states in Europe.

examples.text: The <w>Goths</w> played a significant role in the fall of Rome.
Historians study the migration patterns of the <w>Goths</w>.

senses.sense_definition: An uncivilized, uncultured, or destructive person.

examples.text: He behaved like a total <w>goth</w> at the dinner table.
Only a <w>goth</w> would destroy such a beautiful painting.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to the goth subculture, its music, or its fashion style.

examples.text: Melanie looked very <w>goth</w> compared to her classmates.
She wore heavy <w>goth</w> makeup to the concert.
Mr. <w>Goth</w> was the first to arrive at the meeting.
I have never met anyone with the last name <w>Goth</w>.
